head.title: In Abortion Debate, Clarity Should Rule

hedline.hl1: In Abortion Debate, Clarity Should Rule

block.p: You use the expression ''a woman's right to choose,'' but for some unknown reason, you fail to finish the thought. You say pro-life forces ''are now finding it more productive to chip away at a woman's right to choose.'' And you refer to candidates ''who promise to support a woman's right to choose.'' Choose what?

You use the expression ''a woman's right to choose,'' but for some unknown reason, you fail to finish the thought. You say pro-life forces ''are now finding it more productive to chip away at a woman's right to choose.'' And you refer to candidates ''who promise to support a woman's right to choose.'' Choose what?

Why cannot you tell us the truth about this ''choice''? You could clear up a lot of the fuzziness if you made it clear that you are talking about a woman's ''right'' to have an abortion and terminate her pregnancy.
(Cardinal) ROGER MAHONY Archbishop of Los Angeles Los Angeles, May 28, 2000
